Resistance from teachers: Teachers might feel uncomfortable or unprepared to teach new subjects or methods. This could lead to a lack of enthusiasm or reluctance to implement the new curriculum fully.

Overcrowded schedule: If the new curriculum is implemented without proper planning, it may lead to an overcrowded schedule, causing difficulties in balancing extracurricular activities and assessments.
Lack of student engagement: Students might not be interested in the new subjects or teaching methods, leading to poor engagement and poor performance.
Inadequate training: Teachers may not receive enough training to teach the new curriculum effectively, causing difficulty in execution and poor student learning outcomes.
Insufficient assessment tools: The new curriculum might require new or modified assessment tools, which the school may not have the necessary resources to develop.
